verses.roman:
tomāra āge dhārṣṭya ei mukha-vyādāna"
eta bali' nāndī-śloka karilā vyākhyāna

synonyms: tomāra āge—before you; dhārṣṭya—impudence; ei—this; mukha-vyādāna—simply opening the mouth; eta bali'-saying this; nāndī-śloka—the introductory verses; karilā vyākhyāna—explained.
translation: It is even impudent for me to open my mouth before you." Then, having said this, he recited the introductory verse of Lalita-mādhava.
